CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, page 21, reads: "New Police Appointments - Director of Public Safety Rosenberg, beginning from the left, and Mayor David L. Lawrence congratulate newly appointed Inspector Hugh Mulvey of the 27th Ward, who will serve in Hill District and Downtown. In the row behind them are the newly appointed Lieut. Joseph C. Kovalski of the Sixth Ward, who will replace Mulvey in the lieutenant spot at Centre Ave. Police Station, from which Mulvey was promoted, and newly appointed Sgts. Harry R. Sterlecki of the 10th Ward and William Rocket of the 16th Ward. In the rear row are newly appointed Detectives William D. Best of the 20th Ward and Edward W. Bailey of the 13th Ward. In plain clothes, in front of Bailey, is Superintendent of Police James Slusser. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Director of Public Safety Rosenberg, Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence shaking hands with Inspector Hugh Mulvey, in front of Lieutenant. Joseph C. Kovalski, with Sergeant. Harry R. Sterlecki, and William Rocket in front, Detectives William D. Best, Edward W. Bailey, Superintendent of Police James Slusser in plain clothes in rear, gathered in Pittsburgh City Council Chambers at City County Building
